title: Adding Photos to a Shared Google Photos Album on Android

steps.title: Open Google Photos on your Android.
steps.content: Open Google Photos on your Android. Tap the colored pinwheel icon to open the Photos app. You'll find it on your home screen and/or in your app drawer.

steps.title: Tap the Sharing tab.
steps.content: Tap the Sharing tab. This icon of two overlapping silhouettes is at the bottom of the screen. This displays all shared albums you can browse and edit

steps.title: Tap an album.
steps.content: Tap an album. Tapping an album title displays all of its photos and videos. You'll also see all contributing members' Google profile icons at the top of the album.

steps.title: Tap the icon of a photos with a plus sign .
steps.content: Tap the icon of a photos with a plus sign . You will see this icon at the top of the album. [1] X Research source A list of photos and videos on your Android will appear.

steps.title: Select photos and/or videos to add.
steps.content: Select photos and/or videos to add. When you tap an image to select it, a blue checkmark will appear on that image. You tap multiple photos and/or videos to add multiple files to the album at once.

steps.title: Tap DONE to add the images to the album.
steps.content: Tap DONE to add the images to the album. This option is in the upper-right corner of your screen. The selected photos and/or videos will now be added to the shared album.
